message.content:
It is not ethical to sell a defective product knowingly. Selling a faulty product or providing incorrect information about it can lead to negative consequences for both the seller and the buyer.

When you provide an honest description of your products, customers will trust your brand more as they will have accurate expectations, and you are less likely to deal with returns or complaints in the long run. Moreover, selling defective items may cause harm to consumers depending on what type of product malfunctioning occurs.

Being truthful about each item's condition shows integrity and builds trustworthy relationships between businesses (or sellers) and their customers that may result in successful transactions over time. It's always better to prioritize customer satisfaction, which includes being transparent and fair when conducting business practices.
